overview: The documentary "Las Huellas Del Cerrejón" compiles the experiences of some people who live next to the largest coal mine in the world: Cerrejón. The "responsible mining" as the extraction of coal that is carried out here is called has dried up the waters of the department and has led its inhabitants to deep sadness and despair, however, they remain strong and united in the fight to defend the land where they were born.
title: Las Huellas del Cerrejón
